New Records: Morocco secured a 5-0 victory, setting a new record for the highest score in the match.
Morocco's victory solidified their position at the top of Group B in the AFCON qualifiers.
Key Match Events: Abdel Samad Ezzalzouli scored the first goal in the 18th minute after a rebound.
Azzedine Ounahi scored a stunning strike from outside the box in the 38th minute.
Ounahi scored his second goal and Morocco's third in first-half stoppage time with an assist from Ezzalzouli.
Captain Achraf Hakimi scored Morocco's fourth goal in the 45th minute.
Soufiane Rahimi converted a penalty in the 71st minute to make it 5-0.
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco's head coach Walid Regragui emphasized the importance of controlling midfield possession before the match.
Morocco aimed to secure their third consecutive win to maintain their position at the top of Group B.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Walid Regragui praised the team's performance and noted the need for improved cohesion.
Morocco's victory drew criticism regarding their lackluster displays against deep defensive blocks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Moroccan goalkeeper Yassine Bounou left the match due to a hamstring strain, replaced by Munir El Kajoui.
The match was officiated by Gambian referee Bakary Gassama with assistance from his colleagues.
